metadata.Title: CVE-2021-28650 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
autoar-extractor.c in GNOME gnome-autoar before 0.3.1, as used by GNOME Shell, Nautilus, and other software, allows Directory Traversal during extraction because it lacks a check of whether a file's parent is a symlink in certain complex situations. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2020-36241.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28650` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gnomeautoar-0.1 - 0.2.3-2ubuntu0.3
gir1.2-gnomeautoargtk-0.1 - 0.2.3-2ubuntu0.3
libgnome-autoar-0-0 - 0.2.3-2ubuntu0.3
libgnome-autoar-gtk-0-0 - 0.2.3-2ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnome-autoar package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.2.3-2ubuntu0.3').
